intro: Psacadocalymma falcatum var. stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
